timeline.bodyText:
Change,
"This feature provides support for the MicroProfile Fault Tolerance 3.0 API."
to,
"This feature supports the MicroProfile Fault Tolerance 3.0 API."
timeline.author: ManasiGandhi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+###############################################################################
+# Copyright (c) 2019 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html

+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+###############################################################################
+#
+#ISMESSAGEFILE FALSE
+#NLS_ENCODING=UNICODE
+#NLS_MESSAGEFORMAT_NONE
+#
+
+description=This feature provides support for the MicroProfile Fault Tolerance 3.0 API.

timeline.message:
Fault Tolerance 3.0 metrics changes

Alter the MetricRecorder interface to accommodate the new metrics added
in 3.0.

Implement MetricRecorder for the FT 3.0 metrics.

Fault Tolerance 3.0 metrics changes

Alter the MetricRecorder interface to accommodate the new metrics added
in 3.0.

Implement MetricRecorder for the FT 3.0 metrics.

timeline.bodyText: Does the auto feature need WLP-Activation-Type: parallel too?
timeline.author: tevans78

timeline.bodyText: What is the minimum version of MP Config that FT 3.0 will require? The feature file above says it tolerates 1.1-1.4 ... in which case, this build path should use the 1.1 API? I realise that is subject to change because it will probably also have to support MP Config 2.0.
timeline.author: tevans78
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+
+Bundle-Name: com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance.3.0.metrics
+Bundle-SymbolicName: com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance.3.0.metrics
+
+Bundle-Description:MicroProfile Fault Tolerance 3.0 metrics integration, version ${bVersion}
+
+WS-TraceGroup: FAULTTOLERANCE
+
+-dsannotations: \
+        com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance.metrics.integration.MetricRecorderProvider30Impl
+
+-buildpath: \
+        com.ibm.ws.logging;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.ws.logging.core;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.ws.kernel.service;version=latest,\
+        org.eclipse.osgi;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.websphere.org.osgi.core;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.websphere.org.osgi.service.component;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.wsspi.org.osgi.service.component.annotations;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance.spi;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.websphere.org.eclipse.microprofile.metrics.2.3;version=latest, \
+        com.ibm.websphere.org.eclipse.microprofile.config.1.3;version=latest,\

replies.bodyText: We decided we'd leave this as-is for now, but will update it when we have the features available for MP 4.0
replies.author: Azquelt

timeline.bodyText: This class is kinda hard to read in a github diff ... do you think it needs more doc?
timeline.author: tevans78

timeline.bodyText: Should this package be com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance30.metrics.integration to avoid an future clashes?
timeline.author: tevans78
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2018 IBM Corporation and others.
+ * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+ * are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+ * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+ *
+ * Contributors:
+ *     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+ *******************************************************************************/
+/**
+ * @version 1.0
+ */
+@org.osgi.annotation.versioning.Version("1.0")
+@TraceOptions(traceGroup = "FAULTTOLERANCE")
+package com.ibm.ws.microprofile.faulttolerance.metrics.integration;

timeline.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: Hopefully not, I haven't seen the issue occur on the latest OpenJ9. Once we're happy it's not happening any more, we should go through and remove it from all the test projects.
replies.author: Azquelt
